From our day of birth we are
ella ssified, categorized and put in
a certain group. Human beings
are grouped, regrouped or placed
in neat rows from the crib to the
casket.


Our births are recorded. Our
names are filed. Our footprints
and fingerprints are classified.
We are given race and sex labels.
We are described by height,
weight, skin color, eye color,
teeth formations and birthmarks.


AS we grow older we must have
blood typings, chest x-rays,
vision tests, hearing tests and
vaccinations. Some have had such
a battery of examinations of one
kind or another that they be-
come immune to all kinds of
tests.


There must be another way OF
living in this modern world. Why
must we have so many kinds of
ways to be put in order, scienti-
fic or nonscientific7


Computers now require rows of
numerical distinctions. Our tele-
phone systems must be operated
by row of digits.


We have social security num-
bers, license numbers, tax num-
bers, house numbers, block and
plat numbers and finally we end
in a cemetery with numbered
spaces.


Have you ever written down on
a paper-the different ways that
you are ella ssified7 have tried
and 1t consumes a great amount
of time and space.


The men who travel to the moon
will have the dubious honor of
being Moon Man number l, num-
Der TWO or number three. After

The last years Of former President Her,
bert Hoover sOeYe spent in retirement. At
the age Of ninety one Of the most naaligned
and unfortunate brilliant men to ever occupy
the White House died.


He took office after the end Of the post
World War One rise aOus ending. He took
office TO lead nation which WuS on the brink
of financial chaos. He u0s unable to sove the
country although many Of his reforms and
programs we're later incorporated in the
Roosevelt Plan.
